Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2010 07:29PM sapphire923 wrote: Hi Everyone, I am happy to find this forum and to learn that I am not alone.  I was diagnosed with DCIS in my right breast 2 months ago and the MRI on the left breast revealed atypical ductal hyperplasia all over the breast.  The surgeon, Oncologist and my PC suggested BMX. My BMX with free TRAM reconstruction is scheduled for July 15th.  Had all pre-op testing 2 days ago and met with PS today for photo shots. Waiting seem to be the hardest part since the diagnosis. Although I don't feel any different (no pain, lump etc.) than before the diagnosis just the word cancer has scared me and I have been sitting here wondering where is it spreading now. I don't know what to expect but I am determined to get my life back after the surgery and get back to work.  I hope everything goes ok on the 15th and I will be able to get back to normal.  Thanks again for all your support.  Wish the best to all of you ladies out there.  Geetha (sapphire923)

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2010 02:28PM sapphire923 wrote: Hello everyone, Thanks to everyone for the well wishes and support. My BMX with Tram Flap recon on the 15th feels like a dream, the whole thing was a piece of cake and not as bad as I expected it to be.  I had a wonderful group of doctors and nurses. After the surgery I was kept in so called "step down unit" which is one level lower than ICU so they can keep an eye on the blood flow,temperature etc on the new breast since they did the micro surgery to connect all the blood vessels to the new flap. Came home on the 20th with 6 drains which was really painful and hanging all over. All drains were removed when I went to the followup appointment last Friday (23rd). I expected the worst of pain after the 15 hour surgery but it has been a breeze.  No pain in my abdomen just one big scar end to end. Breasts are very sore and tight. Under arm where the SNB was done is very sore.  I was not able to shower for 10 days and was tough getting through hot days of summer stinking all over. Finally took shower on Saturday.  I still have the compression garment on the stomach and soft front velcro bra. Most of my pain and discomfort is under my arm where the SNB was done and tightness and pulling and tugging in the new breasts. My range of motion is about 75%. Becomes very sore across the chest/breast and tight when I use my hand a lot (like typing on the computer). Right breast looks and feels good. The left looks good but has couple of hard areas, mostly on the side going towards the under arm.  Hope it is not a problem. I will know more tomorrow when I see the PS.  After the tram flap the stomach is pretty flat and looks good. Haven't started driving yet.  youngmomof3: We both had exact same surgery. How many drains did you have? My body looks good.  Breasts look bigger than before, may be there is still some swelling. I like the way my body looks now, with flat stomach and all. Hope you are doing well.  Best wishes for a speedy recovery. Ducki: Hope your drains are out and feeling better. My drains were painful and very uncomfortable. I am glad they are finally out. Orchidgal: I am glad you are on this side now.  Sounds like you had the same good experience I had. Hope you are feeling better. Hope everyone is recovering and feeling better.  My best wishes and prayers to all. Thanks again for all your support and to Orchidgal for moderating this little forum of ours.  Geetha (Sapphire923).
